Find and share free learning and teaching resources available to all which have been deposited by UK HE and FE Institutions.

As some resources are quite large in size it can take some time to prepare them for download. Due to this we require you to supply a valid email address so that you can be notified when your download is ready.

The e-mail address that you submit is only used to inform you when your exported resource is ready for download and is not stored for longer than the time taken to perform this action. For further information on what personal information is stored in Jorum please read the Jorum Privacy Policy.

message.p: The Jorum Service is provided jointly by EDINA and Mimas (together “the Jorum Service Provider”), both of which are UK national academic data centres, designated by JISC on behalf of UK funding bodies.† EDINA is based at the University of Edinburgh and Mimas is based at the University of Manchester. We are committed to preserving your privacy.
For the purpose of the Data Protection Act 1998, the data controller is [the University of Edinburgh, Old College, South Bridge, Edinburgh EH8 9YL].
Please contact the Service Provider at the following postal address or email address if you have questions about this policy:

Jorum Data Protection Coordinator,
EDINA,
The University of Edinburgh,
Causewayside House,
160 Causewayside,
Edinburgh,
Scotland,
United Kingdom
EH9 1PR

This statement sets out how the Jorum Service Provider (“we” or “us”) uses and protects personal information that a User (“you”) provide when using Jorum, in compliance with European Union (EU) and UK data protection requirements.† We are established and based in the United Kingdom (UK). As such, we comply with EU and UK data protection law. If you are resident outside the EU then we cannot confirm that our collection and treatment of personal data is compliant with your local data protection/privacy laws. If you do not agree to your data being dealt with in the manner described in this statement then please do not submit your personal details. However, please note that where you do not submit personal details that we request your access to the services/materials offered by Jorum will be restricted.†
When you register to use Jorum we will grant access to Jorum. As part of the registration process you will be required to provide us with personal information, including:

ul.li: your name and contact information, including e-mail address.

message.p: We may also collect and process personal data from you:

ul.li: when you provide us with your personal details when you fill in any forms on the Jorum site, when you report a problem to us or if you submit an enquiry to us relating to the Jorum Service;
when you respond to any surveys which, for research purposes, we may ask you to complete; and
from your usage of the Jorum Service and data that you post on the Jorum site, e-mail to us or send to us.

message.p: A Registered User may choose to make his or her member profile public or private. Contributions, ratings, reviews, and tags etc. created by Registered Users are intended to become part of the shared Jorum Community knowledge base and as such are created under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 2.0 UK License. For more information on how Jorum manages content provided by Registered Users please consult the Jorum Terms of Service document.
message.h2: What do we do with the information we collect?
message.p: We will use the personal information you provide for the following reasons:

ul.li: administration of your registration including to send you information about the resources that you have deposited in Jorum
to send you information about resources that may interest you (you may choose not to receive these)
as the basis of anonymised statistics about use of the service which are shared with other users and may be published
To help in the investigation and resolution of any legal issues arising out of the use of Jorum

message.h2: Who do we share this information with?
message.p: We reserve the right to disclose the identity of Registered Users to third parties who claim that material contributed infringes their rights (e.g. their privacy or IPR rights).
We reserve the right to disclose criminal activity (e.g. breach of the Computer Misuse Act 1990) to the relevant authorities.
Otherwise, we will not transfer, disclose, sell, distribute or lease your personal information to third parties unless we have your permission or are required to do so by law.
message.h2: How to get copies of the information we have collected
message.p: You may request details of personal information which we hold about you under the Data Protection Act. If you would like a copy of the information held on you please write to; Data Protection Coordinator, Causewayside House, 160 Causewayside, Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom, EH9 1PR; or e-mail support@jorum.ac.uk. If you think that any information we have about you is incorrect or incomplete please write or e-mail us as soon as possible. We will correct or update any information as soon as possible.

Unfortunately, the transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure. Although we will do our best to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee the security of your data transmitted to us; any transmission is at your own risk. However, we will try to ensure that your personal information is secure. In order to try to prevent unauthorised access or disclosure we have put in place suitable physical, electronic and managerial procedures to safeguard and secure the information we collect on-line.

As outlined in the Jorum Terms of Service, we may link to other websites, which are not within our control. Once you have left the Jorum website we cannot be responsible for the protection and privacy of any information which you provide to these sites. You should exercise caution and look at the privacy statement applicable to the website in question.

Jorum uses cookies to store a web application session ID and a Shibboleth session ID. This is required so that you can use the services effectively.† Jorum also integrates with Google Analytics to record user activities so that that the Jorum team can see how many people are using the service and which resources are most popular. Usage statistics are reported to the funding body, JISC.
We may amend this privacy policy from time to time.† If we make any substantial changes we will notify you by posting a prominent notice on the Jorum website.
This policy is based largely on the privacy policy for OpenLearn at the Open University. It is available on the terms of a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.0 Licence†

If so, copy and paste the entire web link directly into your browser's address bar, rather than simply clicking on the link. The address bar should then contain something like:

These tasks are items that are awaiting approval before they are added to the repository. There are two task queues, one for tasks which you have chosen to accept and another for tasks which have not been taken by anyone yet.

The deposit process includes describing the item and uploading the file(s) comprising it.
These are incomplete resource deposits. You may also
These are your completed deposits which are currently being reviewed by subject curators.

Do you want the deposit removed, or do you want to carry on working on it later? You may return to the deposit process if you clicked Exit by accident.

Please visit your Profile page and complete your profile before you make your first deposit.
Please enter the full path of the file on your computer corresponding to your item. If you click "Browse...", a new window will allow you to select the file from your computer.
The item must contain at least one file.

There was a problem uploading your file. Either the filename you entered was incorrect, there was a network problem which prevented the file from reaching us correctly, or you have attempted to upload a file format marked for internal system use only. Please try again.
Optionally, provide a brief description of the file, for example "Main article", or "Experiment data readings".
Please provide a web link before proceeding to the next step
File has failed virus checking, if in doubt please contact {0}.
Optionally, provide a brief description of the contents; for example, "Main article", or "Experiment data readings".
Select the format of the file from the list below, for example "Adobe PDF" or "Microsoft Word." If the format is not in the list, please describe it in the input box below the list.
If the format is not in the above list, select "format not in list" above and describe the file's format in the box below.
The application's name you used to create the file, and the version number (for example, "ACMESoft SuperApp version 1.5").

You must add a licence to your item. Licences govern what people who read your work may then do with it. If you wish to select a Creative Commons licence click the button below. You will be taken to the Creative Commons website, where you will be presented with several licencing options. After selecting a licence, you will be returned to this page.
Proceed to Creative Commons website to select a licence

You must grant a licence to complete your deposit. If you are unable to grant a licence at this time you may save your work and return later or remove the deposit by clicking the 'Save & Exit' button below.
Please select a licence for your content. Licences govern what people who read your work may then do with it.

By clicking on any of the above links to access this resource from Jorum, you agree to accept and comply with the terms of the relevant Creative Commons licence. Jorum has been advised that the full text of this Creative Commons licence contain errors. Nothwithstanding this, when a user downloads a resource from Jorum that is licensed under this licence, they are asked to agree to honour the licensor's intention. They should not make derivative works.

By clicking on any of the above links to access this resource from Jorum, you agree to accept and comply with the terms of the relevant Creative Commons licence. Jorum has been advised that the full text of this Creative Commons licence contain errors. Nothwithstanding this, when a user downloads a resource from Jorum that is licensed under this licence, they are asked to agree to honour the licensor's intention. They should not make derivative works and should use the content only for non-commercial purposes.

Jorum has been advised that the full text of these Creative Commons licences contain errors. Nothwithstanding this, when a user downloads a resource from Jorum that is licensed under either of these licences, they are asked to agree to honour the licensor's intention. In either case they should not make derivative works and in the case of the 'Attribution-NonCommercial-No Derivative Works' Licence they should use the content only for non-commercial purposes.

This resource has been shared under a specific licence.
By previewing, viewing, or downloading this resource, you agree to follow the terms of the licence (view the licence).
An unsupported licence was found in at least one of the resources submitted. All unsupported licences will be replaced with the licence chosen.
There is one last step: In order for Jorum to reproduce, translate and distribute your deposit worldwide, you must agree to the following Terms of Service.
Agree to the Terms of Service by selecting 'I have read and agree to the Terms of Service'; and then click 'Complete Deposit'.
If you have questions regarding the Terms of Service please contact Jorum Support.
I have read and agree to the Terms of Service and the terms of the selected

You must agree to the Terms of Service to complete your deposit. If you are unable to agree to the Terms of Service at this time you may save your work and return later or remove the deposit by clicking the 'Save & Exit' button below.
Your deposit has been cancelled, and the incomplete item removed from the system.

Your deposit will now go through the review process for this subject. You will receive e-mail notification as soon as your deposit has joined the subject, or if there is a problem with your deposit. You may also check on the status of your deposit by visiting your deposits page.
Actions you may perform on this task:
Leave this task in the pool for another to take.
If you have reviewed the item and it is suitable for inclusion in the subject, select "Approve".
Once you've edited the item, use this option to commit the item to the archive.

If you have reviewed the item and found it is not suitable for inclusion in the subject, select "Reject". You will then be asked to enter a message indicating why the item is unsuitable, and whether the submitter should change something and resubmit.
Select this option to change the item's metadata.
Return the task to the pool so that another user may perform the task.
Please enter your reason for rejecting the deposit into the box below, indicating whether the depositor may fix a problem and resubmit.

Are you sure the format should be deleted? Any existing bitstreams of this format will be reverted to the unknown bitstream format.
Are you absolutely sure you want to delete these fields? If any items contain metadata for these fields, the field(s) cannot be deleted. You must ensure that no items use these fields.
This will cause an error if any item contains metadata for these fields.

Are you absolutely sure you want to delete this schema? If any items contain metadata for fields contained within this schema, the schema cannot be deleted. You must ensure that no items contain metadata in this schema.
This will cause an error if any item contains metadata within this schema.

Provide descriptive metadata about the bitstream format below. While format names must be unique, MIME types do not need to be. You may have separate format registry entries for different versions of Microsoft Word, even though the MIME type will be the same for each of them.
A unique name for this format, (e.g. Microsoft Word XP or Microsoft Word 2000)
The MIME type associated with this format, does not have to be unique.
The level of support your institution pledges for this format.
Formats marked as internal are are hidden from the user, and used for administrative purposes.
Extensions are file extensions that are used to automatically identify the format of uploaded files. You can enter several extensions for each format.
This is the metadata schema for "{0}". You may add new or update existing metadata fields to this schema. Fields may also be selected for deletion or be moved to another schema.
Additional notes about this metadata field.
The field name is already in use, all element and qualifiers must be unique.
The field's element contains a bad character. The element may NOT contain: periods, underscores, or spaces.
The field's element is to long, it must be less than 32 characters.
The field's qualifier is to long, it must be less than 32 characters.
The field's qualifier contains a bad character. The qualifier may NOT contain: periods, underscores, or spaces.

This list of bitstream formats provides information about known formats and their support level. You can edit or add new bitstream formats with this tool. Formats marked as 'internal' are hidden from the user, and are used for administrative purposes.

The metadata registry maintains a list of all metadata fields available in the repository. These fields may be divided amongst multiple schemas. However, Jorum requires the qualified Dublin Core schema. You may extend the Dublin Core schema with additional fields or add new schemas to the registry.
Namespace should be an established URI location for the new schema.
Shorthand notation for the schema. This will be used to prefix a field's name (e.g. dc.element.qualifier). The name must be less than 32 characters and cannot include spaces, periods or underscores.
This field is required and must be less than 32 characters and cannot contain any spaces, periods, or underscores.
Select a target schema where these fields will be moved. If the target schema already has fields with identical names the fields will not be moved.
The ID you supplied did not resolve to an item
Items may be found by handle or internal ID
Click here to go to the item wildcard policy admin tool
Click on a sector or subject to edit its policies.
Click here to add a new policy.

With this editor you can view and alter the policies of an item, plus alter policies of individual item components: bundles and bitstreams. Briefly, an item is a container of bundles, and bundles are containers of bitstreams. Containers usually have ADD/REMOVE/READ/WRITE policies, while bitstreams only have READ/WRITE policies.
You will notice an extra bundle and bitstream for each item containing the licence text for the item.
No policies found for this object.
Allows wildcard additions to and clearing of policies for types of content within specific subject(s). WARNING - removing READ permissions from items will make them not viewable!
For all of the selected groups...
...grant the ability to perform the following action...
The following Policies will be removed:

Optionally, provide a brief description of the file, for example "Main article", or "Experiment data readings".
You need the ADD & WRITE privilege on at least one bundle to be able to upload new bitstreams.

Are you sure this item should be withdrawn from the archive?

Optionally, provide a brief description of the file, for example "Main article", or "Experiment data readings"."
Select the format of the file from the list below, for example "Adobe PDF" or "Microsoft Word", OR if the format is not in the list, please describe it in the box below.
If the format is not in the above list, select "format not in list" above and describe it in the field below.
The application you used to create the file, and the version number (for example, "ACMESoft SuperApp version 1.5").
You need the ADD & WRITE privilege on the item and bundles to be able to upload new bitstreams.
You need the REMOVE privilege on the item and bundles to be able to delete bitstreams.
PLEASE NOTE: These changes are not validated in any way. You are responsible for entering the data in the correct format. If you are not sure what the format is, please do NOT make changes.
Welcome to the item management page. From here you can withdraw, reinstate or delete the item. You may also update or add new metadata / bitstreams on the other tabs.
Item Mapper - Map Items from Other Subjects

This is the item mapper tool that allows subject administrators to map items from other subjects into this subject. You can search for items from other subjects and map them, or browse the list of currently mapped items.
{0} of {1} items in this subject are mapped in from other subjects
You need the REMOVE privilege on this subject to be able to unmap items from this subject.

Subject administrators decide who can submit items to the subject, withdraw items, edit item metadata (after deposit), and add (map) existing items from other subjects to this subject (subject to authorization for that subject).
The people responsible for this step are able to accept or reject incoming deposits. However, they are not able to edit the deposit's metadata.
The people responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming deposits, and then accept or reject them.
The people responsible for this step are able to edit the metadata of incoming deposits, but will not be able to reject them.
The E-People and Groups that have permission to submit new items to this subject.

E-People and Groups that can read new items submitted to this subject. Changes to this role are not retroactive. Existing items in the system will still be viewable by those who had read access at the time of their addition.
This subject uses custom default access settings.
Default read for incoming items and bitsreams is currently set to Anonymous.
Are you sure subject {0} should be deleted? This will delete:
Any items and incomplete deposits in this subject that aren't contained in other subjects

Are you sure you want to delete this role? Deleting this group will give READ access to all users for all items submitted to this subject from now on. Please note that this change is not retroactive. Existing items in the system will still be restricted to the members defined by the role you are about to delete.
Are you sure you want to delete this role? All changes and customizations made to the {0} group will be lost and wouuld have to be created anew.
Enter Metadata for a New Subject of {0}
Are you sure sector {0} should be deleted? This will delete:
Any subjects in the sector that are not contained in other sectors
Any items and incomplete deposits in this sector that aren't contained in other sectors

Edit Metadata for a New Top-Level Sector

message.p: This website is using Manakin, a new front end for DSpace created by Texas A&M University Libraries. The interface can be extensively modified through Manakin Aspects and XSL based Themes. For more information visit http://di.tamu.edu and http://dspace.org

catalogue.message: This is not a DSpace object conformant to the METS 1.0 profile and as such cannot be rendered effectively. You can override either the template that handles the general case in dri2xhtml to perform the needed function, or create your template to match whatever profile you use.
There are no files associated with this item.
The following licence files are associated with this item:
The summaryView of a subject is not currently used or implemented. This can be fixed by overriding the dri2xhtml's template named collectionSummaryView.
The summaryView of a sector is not currently used or implemented. This can be fixed by overriding the dri2xhtml's template named communitySummaryView.

Qualified Dublin Core (QDC) is not applicable to Jorum sectors and subjects at this time. When using QDC, you should use the QDC crosswalk for Jorum items and either DIM or MODS for processing of sectors and subjects.

You do not have sufficient privileges to preview, view or download the files contained within this resource due to the licence associated with it. If you still see this message after logging into Jorum, your institution may not have subscribed to the Jorum service. Log in now.
You can access all resources marked with the green tick symbol.
You cannot access resources without this symbol, because your institution does not have the relevant subscription.
You can access all resources marked with the green tick symbol.
